title: Nymphoides hydrophylla
text:
Nymphoides hydrophylla, commonly known as crested floating-heart, is an aquatic plant of the family <a href="Menyanthaceae">Menyanthaceae</a> native to tropical Asia. It has <a href="leaf%20shape">cordate</a> floating leaves that support a lax <a href="inflorescence">inflorescence</a> of dainty white <a href="flower">flower</a>s with fringed petal margins. Its slim <a href="Plant%20stem">stem</a> (spear) is edible, and is used as <a href="vegetable">vegetable</a> in <a href="Taiwan">Taiwan</a>, mostly produced at <a href="Meinong%20District">Meinong District</a>, <a href="Kaohsiung">Kaohsiung</a>.
Flowers of "N.  hydrophylla" are <a href="gynodioecious">gynodioecious</a>. The fruit is a <a href="capsule%20%28fruit%29">capsule</a> bearing many flattened seeds.
The plants are commonly sold for use in ornamental water gardens. Outside their native range they can escape cultivation and become nuisance weeds, particularly in <a href="Florida">Florida</a>. They are not killed by freezing, and have been reported in <a href="Lake%20Marion%20%28South%20Carolina%29">Lake Marion</a>, <a href="South%20Carolina">South Carolina</a>.
